alert.note: Alert for Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 14 at 1:30PM EDT until June 14 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN RANDOLPH AND NORTHEASTERN QUITMAN COUNTIES... At 130 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles east of Georgetown, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Randolph and northeastern Quitman Counties, including the following locations... Benevolence and Wades. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
